text: I believe that I've made a difference in
helping through the medium of wine to
Aid in the transformation of the South
African wine industry about seven years
ago on a very random chance trip to
South Africa I learned an interesting
statistic which was that South Africa
had this amazing 350 year-old industry
wine industry that exported nearly $3
billion dollar worth of wine every year
but less than two% was owned by the
black majority and it was a legacy
that existed during a partti that had
yet to catch up with the transformation
of the industry and while I was living
on campus as a partner since my husband
also went to HBS I got the right idea
that if we didn't do something to help
in the transformation then somebody else
would jump at the chance with the Seven
Sisters a brand that literally is
produced by seven biological sisters who
when the youngest was four and the
oldest was 16 they were evicted from
their land and I'm happy to say that
just two weeks ago the Seven Sisters
became the first wine from South Africa
to hit Walmart shelves in the
US
